content.text: Bash curl Command - Transfer a URL
Using the curl Command
The curl command is used to transfer data from or to a server using various protocols like HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more.
content.html: The curl command is used to transfer data from or to a server using various protocols like HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more.

content.text: It's a versatile tool for downloading files, testing APIs, and more.
content.html: It's a versatile tool for downloading files, testing APIs, and more.

content.text: Basic Usage
To retrieve a web page, use curl url :
content.html: To retrieve a web page, use curl url:

content.code:
curl
http://example.com/file.txt
Hello, this is a test file.
There are three lines here.
This is the last line.
content.code_html:
curl http://example.com/file.txt
Hello, this is a test file.
There are three lines here.
This is the last line.

content.text: Options
The curl command has options to change how it works:
content.html: The curl command has options to change how it works:

content.text: Save the File with the Same Name as the Remote File
The -O option allows you to save the file with the same name as the remote file.
content.html: The -O option allows you to save the file with the same name as the remote file.

content.text: This is useful for downloading files directly to your local system with their original names.
content.html: This is useful for downloading files directly to your local system with their original names.

content.code:
curl
-O http://example.com/file.txt
% Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   134  100   134    0     0    216      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--   218
content.code_html:
curl -O http://example.com/file.txt
% Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   134  100   134    0     0    216      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--   218

content.text: Follow Redirects
The -L option allows you to follow redirects.
content.html: The -L option allows you to follow redirects.

content.text: This is useful when accessing URLs that may redirect to another location.
content.html: This is useful when accessing URLs that may redirect to another location.

content.code:
curl
-L http://example.com/redirect
Hello, this is a test file.
There are three lines here.
This is the last line.
content.code_html:
curl -L http://example.com/redirect
Hello, this is a test file.
There are three lines here.
This is the last line.

content.text: Fetch the HTTP Headers Only
The -I option allows you to fetch the HTTP headers only.
content.html: The -I option allows you to fetch the HTTP headers only.

content.text: This is useful for checking server response headers without downloading the entire content.
content.html: This is useful for checking server response headers without downloading the entire content.

content.code:
curl
-I http://example.com
# Output:
# HTTP/1.1 200 OK
# Date: Wed, 10 Apr 2025 10:00:00 GMT
# Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
# Connection: keep-alive
content.code_html:
curl -I http://example.com
# Output:
# HTTP/1.1 200 OK
# Date: Wed, 10 Apr 2025 10:00:00 GMT
# Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
# Connection: keep-alive

content.text: Send Data with POST Request
The -d option allows you to send data with a POST request. This is useful for submitting form data or interacting with APIs.
content.html: The -d option allows you to send data with a POST request. This is useful for submitting form data or interacting with APIs.

content.code:
curl
-d
"fname=John"
https://www.example.com/action_page.php
Submitted Form Data
Your input was received as:

fname=John
content.code_html:
curl -d "fname=John" https://www.example.com/action_page.php
Submitted Form Data
Your input was received as:

fname=John

content.text: Specify User and Password for Server Authentication
The -u option allows you to specify a user and password for server authentication. This is useful for accessing protected resources.
content.html: The -u option allows you to specify a user and password for server authentication. This is useful for accessing protected resources.

content.code:
curl
-u user:password http://example.com/protected
Hello, this is a test file.
There are three lines here.
This is the last line.
content.code_html:
curl -u user:password http://example.com/protected
Hello, this is a test file.
There are three lines here.
This is the last line.

content.text: Understanding curl Output
The curl command output will vary depending on which options are used:
content.html: The curl command output will vary depending on which options are used:

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which command retrieve a web page the web page http://example.com?
content.html: Which command retrieve a web page the web page http://example.com?
